Class Pet

java.lang.Object
Pet
public class Pet extends Object
The Pet class represents the state and behavior of a virtual pet. It includes properties such as type, health, happiness, and other attributes that can be saved to and read from a file.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Pet(String filename, int lineNum)
    Constructs a Pet object by reading its state from a file.

  • Constructor Details

    • Pet

      public Pet(String filename, int lineNum)
      Constructs a Pet object by reading its state from a file. Throws IllegalArgumentException if the file is incorrectly formatted.
      Parameters:
      filename - the file from which to read the pet's state
      lineNum - the line number to read from the file

    • getMaxHealth

      public int getMaxHealth()
      Returns the maximum health value depending on the pet type. Different pet types have different health capacities.
      Returns:
      the maximum health value

    • writeToFile

      public static void writeToFile(String filename, int lineNum, Pet p)
      Writes the pet's current state to a specified line in a file. If the pet's attributes exceed their logical bounds, they are adjusted before saving.
      Parameters:
      filename - the file to write to
      lineNum - the line number to overwrite or append to
      p - the Pet object whose data is to be written
